questions.question: What traffic signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background?
choices: Pedestrian or bicycle crossings, and school zones

questions.question: Which lane is unavailable or closed?
choices: Lane A with a steady red X
Lane B with a steady green arrow
Lane C with a steady green arrow

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Do not enter the street in this direction
You must pass road obstruction to the left
The road allows traffic to travel in one direction only

questions.question: Which is true about signaling before suddenly reducing speed?
choices: When visible, you may use hand-and-arm signals
It is not necessary to signal when you suddenly reduce speed
You must always use the vehicle's emergency lights

questions.question: A second violation of pedestrian right-of-way laws within a year is:
Who are more likely than others to drive impaired?
What is a good practice to help you maintain a safe space cushion behind your vehicle?
choices: Driving slower than the posted speed limit
Signaling well in advance when you have to slow down or turn

questions.question: Why is it important not to drive with a defective muffler or exhaust system?
choices: Your motor is likely to stall
It causes the engine to run hot
You may be a victim of carbon monoxide poisoning

questions.question: You can use your horn in the following situations EXCEPT:
choices: When you want someone to change lane
When another driver may have trouble seeing you
When a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane

questions.question: To go straight ahead at this intersection, you must enter:
choices: Any of the two left lanes

questions.question: Proof of no-fault and liability insurance is needed:
choices: Only when you appear in court

questions.question: An essential rule for safe night driving is:
choices: Keep your eyes focused to the right side of the road

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout while driving, do not:
When passing a bicyclist, how much room should you give?
When you approach a bicyclist in a multi-lane roundabout, you should:
In Minnesota, it is against the law to hold cell phone in your hand while driving.
What does a line composed of normal white dashes between lanes mean?
choices: You may cross the line with caution
You may cross the line only when passing other vehicles
You may not cross the line under any circumstances

questions.question: You have a green light, and vehicles are blocking your way into the intersection. What should you do?
Which is true about air-bag safety?
choices: Move the driver's seat as close as possible to the dashboard
Air bags do not replace safety belts
Children must always be placed in a seat with an active airbag

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed downhill, and there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Toward the center of the road
Parallel to the side of the road

questions.question: You may legally block an intersection:
choices: When you entered the intersection on the green light

questions.question: A flashing downward yellow arrow over a freeway lane means:
This hand signal means:
Exceeding the speed limit by 10 mph when passing another vehicle:
choices: Is permitted on two-lane highways with a posted speed limit of 55 mph or higher
Is permitted on all roads when the vehicle you are passing speeds up

questions.question: When a school bus with flashing red lights stops on the other side of a four-lane roadway with a median separation, you should:
choices: Stop only when the bus has stopped in a loading zone and pedestrians may cross the roadway

questions.question: True or false? Anyone driving a vehicle with enabled airbags is not required to use seat belts.
An unbroken yellow line on the right-hand side of the centerline means:
choices: You may pass if it is safe to do so

questions.question: The distance it takes to stop a car mainly changes with which of the following?
choices: The size of your blind spots

questions.question: By driving in this state, you have given consent to submit to a test to determine the alcohol or drug content of your blood when requested by:
Which is true about carbon monoxide?
choices: It smells bad, but is not dangerous
It is a colorless, odorless, and poisonous gas
It is only produced when you drive too fast for conditions

questions.question: Which car or cars have the position for a left turn on this one-way street?
choices: Any of the cars in the three lower lanes (marked B, C, and D)
The car in the extreme left lane (marked D)
Any of the cars in the two left lanes (marked C and D)

questions.question: To avoid glare from the high-beam headlights of an approaching car:
choices: Look to the right side of the road
Focus on the center line on the road
Look straight ahead until your eyes recover from the glare

questions.question: If your car stalls on railroad tracks and a train is approaching, you should leave your vehicle and walk quickly:
choices: In the direction from which the train is approaching
In the direction you were traveling
In the same direction as the train is traveling

questions.question: Under the GDL system, the first step for anyone 18 years of age or younger is to obtain:
A yield sign in your lane:
choices: Always gives you the right of way
Means you must slow down or stop, until the way is clear
Is the same as a stop sign or flashing red signal

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
When brakes fail and you cannot get them to work:
choices: Continue driving until you reach a garage
Swing from one side of the road to the other to reduce speed
Ease off the gas, use your parking brake and shift to a lower gear

questions.question: Two vehicles approach an uncontrolled T-intersection. One is on the through road, the other on the road that ends. Which vehicle should have the right-of-way?
choices: The vehicle on the through road

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: You can only turn left from this lane
You cannot turn left from this lane

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should:
choices: Turn on your vehicle's parking lights

questions.question: When overtaking another vehicle on a two-lane road, you must:
choices: Exceed the speed limit to pass quickly
Alert other drivers by using your headlights
Signal the intent to change lane with your turn signal

questions.question: Careless driving is defined as driving or stopping a motor vehicle in a way that:
choices: Takes the driver's attention away from the road
Endangers the lives and safety of people or property
Shows willful or wanton disregard for the safety of people or property

questions.question: How does alcohol affect you?
Stop lines, crosswalks, and parking spaces are marked with:
What does this sign mean?
When a school bus ahead of you is slowing down and displaying flashing amber signals, you must:
choices: Not pass on the right side of the bus
Quickly pass on either side of the bus

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
What does this sign mean?
When must you stop at a railroad-grade crossing?
choices: When you transport children in a passenger vehicle
When a crossing gate is lowered
When the crossing is marked with a crossbuck sign

questions.question: You must always yield the right-of-way to:
When a truck makes a turn:
choices: The rear wheels follow a longer path than the front wheels
The rear wheels and front wheels always follow the same path
The rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels

questions.question: You must obey directions, signals, and instructions from:
Which of the following would be indicated by a circular road sign?
If you notice smoke rising from beneath the hood of your vehicle:
choices: Turn off the engine and steer straight ahead
